meanings.definition: A compound containing a tryptamine structure.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied a tryptamine in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Serotonin is a well-known tryptamine found in the brain.
meanings.sent3: The tryptamine walked into the chemistry class, ready to bond with other molecules.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a tryptamine, sparking new ideas in everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The glowing vial contained a mysterious tryptamine, emitting a faint, ethereal light.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of compounds containing a tryptamine structure, such as serotonin and melatonin.
meanings.sent1: Melatonin is a tryptamine that helps regulate sleep.
meanings.sent2: Many tryptamines play important roles in the body's functions.
meanings.sent3: The tryptamine party in the body never seemed to end, with serotonin and melatonin dancing all night.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden of tryptamines, each flower representing a different compound.
meanings.sent5: The forest was alive with the whispers of tryptamines, their presence felt in every rustle of leaves.
